page.title: 02CALEDONIAN CANAL,FT.AUGUSTUS
page.content: The{Caledonian Canal}runs through the centre of {Fort Augustus.}The passing of boats through the locks always attracts visitors,and during the summer months,many may be observed taking photographs. The canal drops sixteen metres at this point (if you are travelling east) into{Loch Ness }via five locks. There are nine men employed on the canal in {Fort Augustus,}four lock-keepers,three banktenders,a joiner and a foreman. The old capstan bars(for controlling the gates) still stand at the lock gates,but the gates are now controlled by electricity,the change was made in the early sixties. The 97 km long canal,was built at the beginning of the nineteenth century by {Thomas Telford}as a link between the { {North Sea}and the {Atlantic Ocean.
